alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:58AM PST until January 16 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. .Excessive rainfall and runoff from snowmelt through this evening will contribute to further rises on the Coquille River at Coquille through Sunday. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Homes and roads are threatened in low-lying areas along and near the Coquille River. Expect significant widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River estuary to Myrtle Point. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will reach flood stage this afternoon, then continue to rise through Sunday, reaching a maximum value of 23.6 feet Sunday afternoon. The river will remain above flood stage into at least Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.6 feet on 11/21/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Coquille River Coquille 21.0 20.1 Sat 8 am PST 23.5 23.3 20.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM PST.
